column1: #COVID19 vaccines will be on their way soon but the time it will take to distribute and administer means we are still a way off from pre-pandemic normal. Hang onto those masks don't let your guard down and we will get through this. https://t.co/1myG51Efuf

It's stories like these that remind us why we need to continue taking the precautions that we know reduce the spread of #COVID19 -- and they remind me why I'm fighting for hazard pay for frontline workers who are risking their own health to as they care for these patients. https://t.co/HrMZV4w7e2

While #COVID19 surges the risk of large gatherings remains high. With #Thanksgiving approaching here are some recommendations on how you can keep yourself and your loved ones healthy. https://t.co/cS4KjFxtTz

We all want to be able to gather with our extended family & friends for #Thanksgiving but right now we are experiencing the biggest surge in #COVID19 since the pandemic began. Please consider alternative plans to keep your loved ones safe and healthy during this holiday season. https://t.co/cpVsZ1HMr9

The #COVID19 test positivity rate has risen sharply in the past week in Lackawanna County. If you have been exposed please get tested and isolate while you wait for your results. Testing at this site will be free to all patients. 👇 https://t.co/gpGQYjzhVO

It’s encouraging to see that we are making progress on vaccines to fight #COVID19. We still have a way to go so right now we need to stay vigilant about mask-wearing and distancing and make plans to vaccinate Americans fairly when we're ready. https://t.co/hTmChnFqYJ

Public health experts are telling us that the surge in #COVID19 cases and hospitalizations is being driven largely by indoor gatherings as the weather has been getting cooler in NEPA. Please #WearAMask & keep distance from others outside your household. https://t.co/kwprLivHe9

$14.6 million for health centers to respond to COVID-19. $10 million to expand medical training programs. $1.2 million to increase access to substance abuse & mental health services.  A few examples of how federal funding for health initiatives we fought for is working in NEPA. https://t.co/ywByfzETVU

With #COVID19 on the rise again in NEPA we all need to do our part to slow the spread but we also need another relief bill with more funding for mass testing and contact tracing so that health care workers have the tools they need to keep us and our loved ones healthy.

This little machine at Scranton Primary Health Center may not look like much at first but it processes #COVID19 tests in about 10 minutes. I was proud to help them get $1 million+ in federal funding to boost testing capacity & update air filtration to keep patients & staff safe. https://t.co/nFqIbJaGLL
Right now Dr. Decker Dr. Ollar and I are talking about how flu season is coinciding with the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. Tune in below ⬇️ https://t.co/PIZ1YeTurp
STARTING SOON: I'm going live on Facebook with infectious disease experts to discuss the latest spike in #COVID19 cases in NEPA. Watch here. https://t.co/rxakrNsS6g https://t.co/Ect4BfYEX6

The way the Social Security Cost of Living Adjustment is calculated simply does not keep it in line with the costs seniors are facing right now. #COVID19 has only made the problem worse. I'm working to pass legislation to fix COLAs for 2021 and beyond. https://t.co/qkFfKh98xH

Tomorrow @ 5:30 p.m. ET two infectious disease experts will join me live on Facebook to discuss the recent wave of #COVID19 cases in NEPA and how we can keep ourselves and others safe. Tune in here. https://t.co/rxakrNsS6g https://t.co/zLRXvZnkUc

The need for a national #COVID19 testing strategy is more important than ever. There's still $9 billion available to implement widespread testing from what Congress has already authorized -- the time is now for HHS to use it and request more when needed. https://t.co/OiJw0hYR0C

The application for Luzerne County's #CARESAct grant program for our smallest businesses and nonprofits hurt by #COVID19 closes after tomorrow October 14. Find out how to apply here: https://t.co/rZm1cbmRTE https://t.co/1DwsvdYXHk

Our supply chains for #COVID19 response resources are still not where they need to be. Today I introduced a comprehensive plan to bolster America's PPE manufacturing: The MAKE PPE Act is a path to making and buying American personal protective equipment. https://t.co/BIPcpNqZsr

“Too little support would lead to a weak recovery creating unnecessary hardship for households and businesses” – Fed Chair Jerome Powell  We need to continue working toward a #COVID19 relief bill that meets Americans' urgent health & economic needs. https://t.co/svtZFx3dp9

Today is #WorldTeachersDay! This year more than ever we honor our educators' dedication and resolve. I believe we should show our appreciation by enacting relief that enables them to create safe productive learning environments during #COVID19. https://t.co/ZDL5NRGaOa

#COVID19 cases are ticking up again in several states and we still don’t have enough PPE. It’s time for a real national plan to produce and distribute PPE in the US so there’s enough to go around for our health care workers schools and businesses. https://t.co/MLPxRnNWy6

Luzerne County has set aside $11 million in federal #CARESAct money for those hurt by #COVID19: $8 million for small businesses and $3 million for non-profits. The application is open until October 14. Apply here: https://t.co/rZm1cbmRTE  https://t.co/kyFi0EKpe9

I wish the President and First Lady well and pray they quickly recover. Right now let's remember that #COVID19 can affect anyone. It's up to all of us to wear masks maintain a safe distance from others when in public and promptly get tested if symptoms arise.

Last month @fema stopped providing emergency relief to states to help schools cover mask and sanitation costs during #COVID19. My colleagues and I are calling on FEMA to resume this relief to keep our children teachers and families safe. Full letter: https://t.co/GuC8QWQSeu https://t.co/39WWNd4ojI

Nearly 3 million people in the US have recovered from #COVID19. That means there are nearly 3 million people with a new pre-existing condition who could be at risk of losing their coverage if the GOP's lawsuit against the #ACA is successful. https://t.co/JlKBicgobP

We're seeing #COVID19 cases start to tick up again in certain parts of #PA08. Remember that we all have a role in slowing the spread: 😷Wear a mask when in public ⬅️➡️Maintain distance from others & avoid large crowds 🤲Wash your hands often We can do this NEPA. #COVIDStopsWithMe https://t.co/yg75iBNlqJ

We can’t afford any longer to let states fend for themselves and compete against each other to address the ongoing public health and economic challenges we still face especially as the fall threatens to bring another deadly COVID-19 wave.

We grieve the unfathomable 200K American lives lost to #COVID19 & we mourn w/ the families who survive them. COVID has taken away loved ones jobs & livelihoods- the passage of today’s grim milestone is a reminder of why it’s long past time for a strong sustained nat'l response.

Luzerne County small business/nonprofit owners: County leaders announced today that $11 million in federal #CARESAct relief funding will be available for those hurt by #COVID19. The application opens October 1 for two weeks. Find out more here: https://t.co/HOQf1MOtEI https://t.co/NlobMhLGxe

Proud to announce $1.15 million in federal funding coming to @WRCScranton to boost their legal & housing resources for domestic violence survivors. Their work is especially important now as we see domestic violence on the rise amid #COVID19... 1/2 https://t.co/6PSPSByEGN

#COVID19 has led to big state revenue shortfalls meaning state leaders will face hard choices about funding for services the most vulnerable among us rely on. For our seniors & those with disabilities we need to pass relief to keep these services going. https://t.co/6D5RvH1JUR

Mitch McConnell finally abandoned his failed “wait & see” approach to #COVID19 response. But his bill falls tragically short on support for state/local frontline workers rental assistance and food security.   The #HeroesAct is by far the better starting point for negotiations.

It's clear by now that nursing home residents are among the most vulnerable to #COVID19. With colder weather coming we can't wait any longer to pass a relief bill that provides resources to mitigate outbreaks and respond to them quickly if they do occur. https://t.co/6iR4zKgTm4

NEPA educators tell me #CARESAct funding was critical to helping them restart school but much more is needed so they can provide the best learning experience possible amid #COVID19. .@SenBobCasey & members of the PA Congressional delegation pushed for this extension to provide peace of mind for parents and students struggling to afford food during #COVID19. https://t.co/pnaGsO5Vd1

Schools shouldn't be left to face the challenge of #COVID19 alone. We passed the #HeroesAct to provide relief to schools to promote safe productive learning environments for our kids. Senate Republicans need to join us & negotiate to protect our students. https://t.co/QPi6lHUFGk

Senate Leader Mitch McConnell has ignored the #HeroesAct for 100+ days allowing small business relief and unemployment benefits to expire ahead of a potentially deadly fall #COVID19 wave. The GOP needs to meet us halfway and allow negotiations to resume!

USPS leadership is sabotaging mail delivery at a time when millions are hoping to rely on it to vote safely from home during #COVID19. The #HeroesAct would provide nearly $130 million to Pennsylvania to support election security & mail-in voting. We need the Senate to negotiate! https://t.co/TPYLijkrcc

We’re at a serious inflection point with coronavirus in our nation. COVID-19 case rates are still on the rise while enhanced unemployment income for millions has expired small businesses’ relief money is running dry and PPE shortages & testing backlogs are a constant worry. 1/5

Restaurants and hospitality are not just essential to NEPA’s economy they’re core parts of the social and cultural fabric of our area. But many are struggling due to #COVID19.  I support the #RestaurantsAct to save our local restaurants and the livelihoods of their employees. https://t.co/kprteTEZAo

#COVID19 case numbers have been relatively low in NEPA in recent weeks but we’re starting to see an uptick in some of our counties. While the #COVID19 outlook and our economic future are still so uncertain we should not be cutting income for millions who don't have jobs to go back to.
